required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Treatment-Related Symptom Management in Adolescents and Young Adults With Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Treatment-Related Symptom Management in Adolescents and Young Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test the acceptability and feasibility of a telehealth intervention to improve communication between patients and medical providers in adolescent and young adult (AYA) cancer patients receiving chemotherapy treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 2 telehealth visits with a medical provider (either an MD or NP) after last chemotherapy administration in the cycle, or as otherwise indicated

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Completing the Trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: end of the study period (6 cycles of chemotherapy for each participant, where each cycle is 14-28 days)
primary_outcome.description: >65% of enrolled patients will complete the trial

secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of the study period (6 cycles of chemotherapy for each participant, where each cycle is 14-28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: >%70% of enrolled patients will complete the survey instruments

secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of the study period (6 cycles of chemotherapy for each participant, where each cycle is 14-28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: A composite score of â‰¥40 (based on 10 items with a Likert scale of 1-5 strongly disagree to strongly agree)

arm_group.description: Observation periods will be from 4 days post last administration of chemotherapy until the next chemotherapy administration. All patients will undergo an initial observation period that will span two chemotherapy cycles and will be receiving clinical care as usual determined by the primary oncology team. Patients enrolled on the immediate arm will start the intervention (telehealth visits) in Time Period 2 (following chemotherapy cycles 3 and 4). During Time Period 3 (following chemotherapy cycles 5 and 6), this arm will resume clinical care as usual.

Observation periods will be from 4 days post last administration of chemotherapy until the next chemotherapy administration. All patients will undergo an initial observation period that will span two chemotherapy cycles and will be receiving clinical care as usual determined by the primary oncology team. Patients enrolled on the delayed arm will receive clinical care as usual during Time Period 2 (following chemotherapy cycles 3 and 4). During Time Period 3 (following chemotherapy cycles 5 and 6), this arm will start the intervention (telehealth visits).

intervention.description: Receiving telehealth visits with a medical provider (MD or NP) 2-3 days after last chemotherapy administration in the cycle
Receiving care as usual from the UC Davis Comprehensive Cancer Center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with cancer undergoing active treatment and who have received at least two cycles of chemotherapy
- Access to Epic MyChart (we will facilitate access to MyChart for interested patients who are not yet signed up)
- Access to a smartphone or tablet to access EPIC MyChart telehealth appointments
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-English or non-Spanish speaking patients
- Potentially completing therapy during study period (including follow-up period) or plans to leave UCDCCC during study period

link.description: Learn more or sign up for the study here!
